Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a Football World Cup program Game class. The program starts when the playGame() method invoked. First for all teams that are listed in the teams.txt document, player names are needed to be entered. After all player names are saved, program menu will appear and selections can be made.
    Version:
    09/05/2018
    Author:
    Tuna Rezaiazar

      This method displays the results of a match between 2 teams.
      void enterPlayerNames(Team t)
      This method gets input from the user for team player names.
      void fileReader()
      This method reads the teams.txt file and creates the team objects for league with given names and rankings in the file.

      This method checks the teams that have lowest yellow/red card status in a league and prints the Fair Play Award accordingly.

      This method checks the team player who has the most goals in a league prints the Golden Boot Award accordingly.

      This is the main method to play the program/league.

      If the final ends in a draw, this method helps to decide the winner.

      This method plays the final match for the given teams.

      This method plays the preliminary match for the given teams.

      This method sorts the team array list according to their league points.

    • Method Detail

      • displayGameResult

        public void displayGameResult(Team t1,
                              Team t2,
                              int goal1,
                              int goal2,
                              int yellow1,
                              int red1,
                              int yellow2,
                              int red2)
        This method displays the results of a match between 2 teams. It shows the goal numbers and cards that are given in a single match.
        Parameters:
        t1 - Team 1 object that has match.
        t2 - Team 2 object that has match.
        goal1 - goal number of Team 1 in a match against Team 2.
        goal2 - goal number of Team 2 in a match against Team 1.
        yellow1 - yellow cards that are given to Team 1.
        red1 - red cards that are given to Team 1.
        yellow2 - yellow cards that are given to Team 2.
        red2 - red cards that are given to Team 2.

      • enterPlayerNames

        public void enterPlayerNames(Team t)
        This method gets input from the user for team player names. Method has also validation controls for entered names by the user according to requirements.
        Parameters:
        t - Team 1 object that player needs to be changed.

      • fileReader

        public void fileReader()
        This method reads the teams.txt file and creates the team objects for league with given names and rankings in the file.

      • getFairPlay

        public java.lang.String getFairPlay()
        This method checks the teams that have lowest yellow/red card status in a league and prints the Fair Play Award accordingly.
        Returns:
        the fair play award winners as String

      • getGoldenBoot

        public java.lang.String getGoldenBoot()
        This method checks the team player who has the most goals in a league prints the Golden Boot Award accordingly.
        Returns:
        the golden boot award winners as String.

      • playGame

        public void playGame()
        This is the main method to play the program/league. When methods ends league statistics are saved in 'statistics.txt' file.

      • playPenaltyShootOut

        public void playPenaltyShootOut()
        If the final ends in a draw, this method helps to decide the winner.

      • setPlayerGoals

        public void setPlayerGoals(Team t,
                           int score)
        This method sets the player goals in a single match for a team.
        Parameters:
        t - team that players goaled.
        score - teams goal number in a single match.

      • setTeamRedCards

        public int setTeamRedCards(Team t)
        This method sets the red cards for a team.
        Parameters:
        t - team that red cards are given.

      • setTeamYellowCards

        public int setTeamYellowCards(Team t)
        This method sets the yellow cards for a team.
        Parameters:
        t - team that yellow cards are given.

      • startFinalMatch

        public void startFinalMatch()
        This method plays the final match for the given teams.
        Parameters:
        t1 - team 1 that is going to play final.
        t2 - team 2 that is going to play final.

      • startPreMatch

        public void startPreMatch(java.lang.String s1,
                          java.lang.String s2)
        This method plays the preliminary match for the given teams.
        Parameters:
        s1 - name of the team 1 that is going to play the preliminary match.
        s2 - name of the team 2 that is going to play the preliminary match.

      • teamSort

        public void teamSort()
        This method sorts the team array list according to their league points.
